question: 5 (a)
sols_html:
If we find the row reduced echelon form we get that

\(rref(A)=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0& 1\\ 0&0 \end{bmatrix}\)

Take the pivot columns to be our column space

\(R(A)=\{ \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix},\begin{bmatrix} 0\\ 1\\ 1 \end{bmatrix} \}\)

We can then find the orthonormal basis

let \(r_1= \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}\) and \(r_2= \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1\\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\)

let \(u_1,u_2\) be the orthonormal vectors we wish to find

\(u_1=\frac{r_1}{\left \| r_1 \right \|}\)\(=\frac{1}{\sqrt2}\begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 1\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}\)

\(u_2=\frac{r_2-proj_{u_1}(r_1)}{\left \| r_2-proj_{e_1}(r_1) \right \|}\) = \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{\frac{3}{2}}}\begin{bmatrix} -0.5\\ 0.5\\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\)

\(A=QR\)

where Q is the matrix formed by the orthonormal basis and R is upper triangular with position diagonal entries

\(A=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 1& 1\\ 0&1 \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix} \frac{1}{\sqrt2} & -\frac{\sqrt2}{2\sqrt3} \\ \frac{1}{\sqrt2}& \frac{\sqrt2}{2\sqrt3}\\ 0&\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}} \end{bmatrix}R\)

Solving yields

\(R=\begin{bmatrix} \sqrt2 & \frac{1}{\sqrt2}\\ 0& \sqrt{\frac{3}{2}} \end{bmatrix}\)
sols_latex:
If we find the row reduced echelon form we get that

$rref(A)=\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 \\
0& 1\\
0&0
\end{bmatrix}$

Take the pivot columns to be our column space

$R(A)=\{ \begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix},\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
1\\
1
\end{bmatrix} \}$

We can then find the orthonormal basis

let $r_1= \begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix}$ and $r_2= \begin{bmatrix}
0 \\
1\\
1
\end{bmatrix}$

let $u_1,u_2$ be the orthonormal vectors we wish to find

$u_1=\frac{r_1}{\left \| r_1 \right \|}$$=\frac{1}{\sqrt2}\begin{bmatrix}
1\\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix}$

$u_2=\frac{r_2-proj_{u_1}(r_1)}{\left \| r_2-proj_{e_1}(r_1) \right \|}$
= $\frac{1}{\sqrt{\frac{3}{2}}}\begin{bmatrix}
-0.5\\
0.5\\
1
\end{bmatrix}$

$A=QR$

where Q is the matrix formed by the orthonormal basis and R is upper
triangular with position diagonal entries

$A=\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 \\
1& 1\\
0&1
\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}
\frac{1}{\sqrt2} & -\frac{\sqrt2}{2\sqrt3} \\
\frac{1}{\sqrt2}& \frac{\sqrt2}{2\sqrt3}\\
0&\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}}
\end{bmatrix}R$

Solving yields

$R=\begin{bmatrix}
\sqrt2 & \frac{1}{\sqrt2}\\
0& \sqrt{\frac{3}{2}}
\end{bmatrix}$

0&0

Take the pivot columns to be our column space

<math>R(A)=\{ \begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix},\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
1\\
1
\end{bmatrix} \}</math>

We can then find the orthonormal basis

let <math>r_1= \begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
1\\
0

1\\
1
\end{bmatrix}</math>

let <math>u_1,u_2</math> be the orthonormal vectors we wish to find

<math>u_1=\frac{r_1}{\left \| r_1 \right \|}</math><math>=\frac{1}{\sqrt2}\begin{bmatrix}
1\\
1\\
0
\end{bmatrix}</math>

<math>u_2=\frac{r_2-proj_{u_1}(r_1)}{\left \| r_2-proj_{e_1}(r_1) \right \|}</math> = <math>\frac{1}{\sqrt{\frac{3}{2}}}\begin{bmatrix}
-0.5\\
0.5\\
1
\end{bmatrix}</math>

<math>A=QR</math>

where Q is the matrix formed by the orthonormal basis and R is upper triangular with position diagonal entries

<math>A=\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 \\
1& 1\\
0&1
\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}
\frac{1}{\sqrt2} & -\frac{\sqrt2}{2\sqrt3} \\
\frac{1}{\sqrt2}& \frac{\sqrt2}{2\sqrt3}\\
0&\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}}
\end{bmatrix}R</math>

Solving yields

<math>R=\begin{bmatrix}
\sqrt2 & \frac{1}{\sqrt2}\\
0& \sqrt{\frac{3}{2}}
\end{bmatrix}</math>
statement_html:
A matrix A and a vector b are given by

\(\displaystyle A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 1 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}\)

\(\displaystyle b = \begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{bmatrix}\)

Find an orthonormal basis for the column space of A (i.e. for R(A)). Express the matrix A in the form A = QR, where Q is a matrix with orthonormal columns and R is upper triangular and with positive diagonal entries.
statement_latex:
A matrix \emph{A} and a vector \emph{b} are given by

$\displaystyle A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 1 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$

$\displaystyle b = \begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{bmatrix}$

Find an orthonormal basis for the column space of A (i.e. for R(A)).
Express the matrix A in the form A = QR, where Q is a matrix with
orthonormal columns and R is upper triangular and with positive diagonal
entries.
statement_raw:
A matrix ''A'' and a vector ''b'' are given by

<math> \displaystyle A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 1 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}</math>

<math> \displaystyle b = \begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{bmatrix}</math>

Find an orthonormal basis for the column space of A (i.e. for R(A)). Express the matrix A in the form A = QR, where Q is a matrix with orthonormal columns and R is upper triangular and with positive diagonal entries.
